Let M be a realisation system . We spell out what a realisation system E given by an extension of \mathbb {Q} (0) by M is, when M is of weight \leqslant-1 (i.e. M=W_{-1}(M)).

E_ { \mathrm {B}} is an extension M_ { \mathrm {B}} \to E_ { \mathrm {B}} \xrightarrow {u} \mathbb {Q} of \mathbb {Q} by M_ { \mathrm {B}}. Its data is equivalent to that of P_ { \mathrm {B}} \coloneqq u^{-1}(1), endowed with its structure as a torsor (principal homogeneous space) for M_ { \mathrm {B}}, i.e. m \in M_ { \mathrm {B}} acts on P_ { \mathrm {B}} via p \mapsto p+m.
The data of E_ { \mathrm {DR}} is equivalent to that of a torsor P_ { \mathrm {DR}} for M_ { \mathrm {DR}}.
The data of E_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f} is equivalent to that of a torsor P_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f} for M_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f}.
The data of E_ { { \mathrm {cris}} \, \, p} is equivalent to that of a torsor P_ { { \mathrm {cris}} \, \, p} for M_ { { \mathrm {cris}} \, \, p}.

The comparison morphisms for E can be identified with comparison morphisms P_ { \mathrm {B}} \otimes \mathbb {C} \xrightarrow { \sim } P_ { \mathrm {DR}} \otimes \mathbb {C}, P_ { \mathrm {B}} \otimes \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f} \xrightarrow { \sim } P_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f}, and P_ { \mathrm {DR}} \otimes \mathbb {Q} _p \xrightarrow { \sim } P_ { { \mathrm {cris}} \, \, p} that are compatible with the analogous morphisms for M.

Since M is, by hypothesis, of weight \leqslant-1, and \mathbb {Q} (0) is of pure weight 0, the weight filtration of E is determined by that of M, i.e. W_0(E)=E, and W_i(E)=W_i(E) for i<0.

The data of F_ \infty for E is equivalent to that of an involution of P_ { \mathrm {B}} that is compatible with that of M_ { \mathrm {B}}. Axiom (AM2) for E is that this involution is induced by the \mathbb {C}-antilinear involution of P_{ { \mathrm {B}} , \mathbb {C} }= \mathbb {P} _{ { \mathrm {DR}} , \mathbb {C} } with fixed points P_{ { \mathrm {DR}} , \mathbb {R} }.

The data of the Hodge filtration of E_ { \mathrm {DR}} is equivalent to that of the intersection F^0P_ { \mathrm {DR}} of F^0E_ { \mathrm {DR}} over P_ { \mathrm {DR}}, which is a torsor for F^0M_ { \mathrm {DR}}: for p>0, F^pE_ { \mathrm {DR}} =F^pM_ { \mathrm {DR}}; for p=0, F^0E_ { \mathrm {DR}} is generated by F^0P_ { \mathrm {DR}}; and for p<0, F^pE_ { \mathrm {DR}} is the sum of F^0E_ { \mathrm {DR}} and F^pM_ { \mathrm {DR}}. In other words, the data (M8) for E_ { \mathrm {DR}} is that of a reduction of the structure group of P_ { \mathrm {DR}}, from M_ { \mathrm {DR}} to F^0M_ { \mathrm {DR}}.

The data of (M1), (M2), \operatorname {comp} _{ { \mathrm {DR}} {/} { \mathrm {B}} }, and (M8) are equivalent to the data of a torsor F^0P_ { \mathrm {DR}} for F^0M_ { \mathrm {DR}} and, in the M_ { \mathrm {DR}} \otimes \mathbb {C} =M_ { \mathrm {B}} \otimes \mathbb {C} torsor P_{ { \mathrm {DR}} , \mathbb {C} } which is induced by F^0M_ { \mathrm {DR}} \to M_ { \mathrm {DR}} \otimes \mathbb {C}, a \mathbb {Q}-structure P_ { \mathrm {B}} \subset P_{ { \mathrm {DR}} , \mathbb {C} } that is an M_ { \mathrm {B}} torsor.

The data of the action of \operatorname {Gal} ( \bar { \mathbb {Q} }/ \mathbb {Q} ) on E_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f} is equivalent to that of an action of \operatorname {Gal} ( \bar { \mathbb {Q} }/ \mathbb {Q} ) on P_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f}, which makes P_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f} an equivariant M_ \mathbb {A} ^ \mathrm {f}-torsor.

Similarly, the automorphism \phi _p of E_ { \mathrm {DR}} \otimes \mathbb {Q} _p corresponds to an automorphism \phi _p of P_ { \mathrm {DR}} \otimes \mathbb {Q} _p such that \phi _p(x+m) = \phi _p(x) + \phi _p(m).

We leave to the reader the task of translating axioms (AM1) to (AM5) for P. We note only that (AM1) and (AM4) follow from the same axioms for M, and that (AM2) and (AM5) can be expressed at best as functoriality in \mathbb {C}, cf. .

We denote by \otimes an extension of scalars. For example, if X is a scheme over k, and k' is an extension of k, then we set X \otimes k' \coloneqq X \times _{ \operatorname {Spec} (k)} \operatorname {Spec} (k').
